problem.markdown:

2. Prerequisite of protein aggregation is : () Mutation. () Protein folding. (x) Protein denaturation. () None of the above.
3. Why CD spectroscopy is a convenient technique to study protein aggregation? () CD spectra of folded and random coil are similar. (x)CD spectra of folded and random coil are quite different. () In the aggregated state the spectra is absent in CD. () In the folded state the spectra is absent in CD.
4. Dynode voltage gives the indication of : () Reflection of light. (x) Absorption of light. () Emission of light. () Refraction of light.
5. What happens when the protein aggregates? (x)Its size increases and more light is scattered. () Its size decreases and less amount of light is scattered. () Its size increases and less amount of light is scattered. () Its size decreases and more light is scattered.
